alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:18PM EST until December 19 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... Brandywine Creek At Wilmington affecting New Castle County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Brandywine Creek at Wilmington. * WHEN...From this evening to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Minor flooding begins along the creek in the Brandywine State Park. At 16.5 feet, North Park Drive, west of North Market Street, in Brandywine State Park is subject to flooding and closures. At 17.0 feet, Some flooding begins in the historic Breck`s Mill area in Montchanin. At 18.0 feet, Ramsey Road is subject to closures between Del. 92 and Beaver Dam Road as the Brandywine backs up into Ransey Run. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 17.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 PM EST Monday was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 12.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 02/25/2016. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Brandywine Creek Wilmington 16.5 17.1 Mon 8 pm 13.5 12.8 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at midnight EST.
